item.title: O/s 129, 29th December
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: I would like action to be taken about the road side council owned tree in front of 129 Palace View, BR1 3EP. It is not pruned or pollarded regularly and the tree roots are lifting the pavement and our drive. In addition, the branches overhanging our property are increasingly causing problems as birds roost over our drive and we have large amounts of bird faeces that pile up on our drive causing a slip and health hazard. I have reported issues with this tree in the past and been told it will not be removed and that pollarding is not appropriate. The last time I made a report was January 2025 under reference 6987577 and received the following reply: “This tree has been inspected and is not considered to require remedial works at this time. Bromley will only undertake works to a tree for an identified health & safety or highway obstruction issue. The situation will be reviewed cyclically and any required action will be addressed within a future works programme.” I don’t believe it has been reviewed since, meanwhile the damage to my property is getting worse. At a minimum the tree should be pruned over my drive to remove the daily health hazard of bird faeces. In addition the council should be offering some recompense to repair the drive and a proposal to prevent further damage to my property. Whilst I could raise a legal claim, this does not seem an efficient means to resolution for either party, particularly if the issue will continue to recur. • What action (if any) would you like us to take? Review the tree and ongoing damage to my property and discuss options to resolve the issues with me.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace View, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked, silted up leaf filled drains, 29th December
item.description:
Ongoing problem EVERY year, discussed in person with Mr Jim Cowan, exacerbated by POOR quality and/or ‘missed’ road and footway sweeping per the published Bromley Council website. If you FAIL to ensure that the roads and footways of Chislehurst are not even swept and cleaned per the schedule, the knock on effect is blocked drains, as witnessed here in Old Hill, plus: Lubbock Road, Lower Camden, Summerhill, Watts Lane etc etc. Bromley Council you MUST do better in 2026……
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Hill, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars being dumped, 29th December
item.description:
So over last year we have had a guy dumping cars vans in parking spaces on the whole estate not just visitors parking but in numbered allocated parking this happens in Cornwallis close Frobisher road and Rayleigh close he uses the estate to run a breakers from it and he don’t even live on the estate dvla seem only to ticket a couple and miss the ones in the allocated spaces and ones at the bottom of the roads space for parking is tight as it is and this guy seems not to care the photos I’ve added is him moving cars in and out and some of the cats that are dumped

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cornwallis Close, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
